title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is the short title of this Act. It transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Section 526 of the Revised Statutes is amended to require the Secretary to take a census of agriculture every 5 years, with necessary data collection methods. The data collected will relate to the year before each census. Refusal to answer questions is prohibited. The Secretary is required to conduct a census of agriculture every 5 years with necessary data collection methods. Refusal to answer questions in connection with the census is subject to penalties under title 13, United States Code. The census under this subsection must include each State, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana. Failure to disclose a social security number in response to a request for the census is not a violation. Each census under this subsection must include each State, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, as well as other areas under U.S. jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information collected under title upon request from the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of State must approve any actions in areas under U.S. jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture must provide information to the Secretary of Commerce upon request for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture must provide information to the Secretary of Commerce for census purposes upon request. Any information shared can only be used for statistical purposes. Regulations for this process can be determined by the Secretary. Effective October 1, 1998, regulations for census purposes will be determined by the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of Commerce. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, and related items are repealed. Section 142 of title 13, United States Code, and related items are repealed. Section 343(a)(11)(F) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. The text discusses amending sections of the United States Code related to furnishing information to the Department of Agriculture and Department of Commerce, specifically regarding confidentiality of information. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to allow for the release of information under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes. Information provided under this section shall be treated as confidential for certain purposes under title 13 of the United States Code.
